info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 1:04PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL ROOSEVELT, EASTERN DE BACA AND CENTRAL CHAVES COUNTIES THROUGH 145 PM MDT... At 104 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sumner Lake to near Mesa to 28 miles northwest of Bitter Lake Wildlife Refuge to 21 miles southwest of Roswell. Movement was southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roswell, Fort Sumner, Dexter, Hagerman, Mesa, Bitter Lake Wildlife Refuge, Elkins, Taiban, Bottomless Lakes State Park and Lake Arthur. This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 79 and 157. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 317 and 345. Highway 380 between Mile Markers 156 and 184. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
